name: charts
description: The charts module provides a JavaScript API for visualizing data in a variety of formats accross all A-grade browsers.
author: tripp

examples.name: charts-simple
examples.description: Shows how to use Charts to create a basic chart.

examples.name: charts-multiseries
examples.description: Shows how to create a chart with multiple series.

examples.name: charts-column
examples.description: Shows how to create a column chart with multiple series.

examples.name: charts-stackedcolumn
examples.description: Shows how to create a column chart with a stacked numeric axis.

examples.name: charts-timeaxis
examples.displayName: Create a Chart with a Time Axis
examples.description: Shows how to create a chart with a time axis.

examples.name: charts-gridlines
examples.description: Shows how to add gridlines to a chart.

examples.name: charts-stackedarea
examples.displayName: Create a Stacked Area Chart with Planar Based Events
examples.description: Shows how to create a chart with planar based events.

examples.name: charts-globalstyles
examples.description: Shows how to use a chart's styles attribute to customize a chart.

examples.name: charts-customizedtooltip
examples.description: Shows how to customize the default tooltip of a chart.

examples.name: charts-objectstyles
examples.displayName: Define a Chart's Axes and Series
examples.description: Shows how to explicitly define the axes and series for a chart.

examples.name: charts-pie
examples.description: Shows how ot use charts to create a pie chart.

examples.name: charts-dualaxes
examples.description: Shows how to create a chart with multiple value axes.

examples.name: charts-axisupdate
examples.description: Shows how to access a chart instance's value axis after the chart has rendered.

examples.name: charts-seriesupdate
examples.description: Shows how to access a chart instance's seriesCollection after the chart has rendered.
